comment: I took this course as a 4-week course during the sum. semester. It was a total of 4 discussion boards, a quiz for each chapter of the textbook, and a midterm and final. Make sure to watch the lectures; some questions on quizzes/exams are only in there! Study guides are provided. Read rubrics for discussion boards carefully. Great professor overall!

Enthusiastic and caring professor. His lectures are always interesting and engaging. Power points and textbook readings are clear and concise. Non-cumulative final exam that replaces 1 of your previous exam grades (you only need to take 3/4 exams). Decent amount of in-class activities that keeps things interesting. Would recommend for credit.

I took him for Psych 1101 not 2210. Overall he is such a sweet and caring professor. Personally I found this class dragged on and boring, but that's because I took it in high school. Don't steer away from taking his class just because you see average ratings. Everyone has different opinions and I would take the professor again just not 1101!!

Difficulty of an above average level core highschool class. He is hilarious and gives out assignments mid class for participation grade which are always a good break from looking at PowerPoints. He makes the class very interesting and would almost go as far as to say it's fun. Doesn't accept late work but gives plenty of time to do so.

I loved having Dr.James as our professor. He provides extremely detailed feedback for all grades as well as has some terrific communication skills with his students. He is a tough grader, but just wants to see you succeed. Only two exams which are open note (yay). I felt like I was given the opportunity to actually learn something with him. :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: James is, by far, my favorite professor I've ever had at KSU. He is extremely funny and his lectures are easy to listen to. I took his class 3 semesters and I wish I could take more.

This was a great class and enjoyable! I just followed the instructions precisely, acted on his feedback, and walked away with an 'A'. I had to put in effort, but that is what learning is about. It was worth it.

Great professor who truly cares about his students. Was super understanding about my absences and tardiness to his class even though I didn't have a good excuse he didn't care. He didn't even ask if I had one because he understood it could have been personal. He puts in extra effort to help you succeed, even when you fall short.
Attending this class helped me to have confirmation and reassurance that I have chosen the right career. It was interactive and enjoyable.

Y'all need to quit complaining about not getting your way and always wanting an easy A, and do the work he sets. This prof delivers what he says he will, and I have had him for 2 courses. Sure he has higher standards but whats the point of coming to class if youre only going to stay in your comfort zone. Give him a shot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment:
I loved this class. Professor Williams was very enthusiastic which made the class more interesting and lively. He made learning new material more personal but through group work so we were able
to better understand what we wanted individually to do in our future, but also consult other classmates.

Dr. Williams actively supported my learning. His discussion post replies helped me gain a better understanding of the course material and was one of if not the most helpful professor I have ever had because I had alot of hardship during the course and he was understanding and very responsive.

I took this course during a summer semester, and he was consistently helpful, encouraging, organized, extremely positive and replied quickly to emails when asked questions. Prof. Williams was passionate about the teaching material,amd the quizzes and tests are well written.

Clearly passionate and enjoys teaching. I enjoyed the class but the larger assignments are graded extremely strictly and you will get low grades on assignments you thought you did well. Take this class if it's your only option, but you should expect a C or lower if you are an A student.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Summer class went great. He was engaged, frequent updates, and caring.

Dr. Williams is a knowledgable professor who prepares students for tougher classes. We had a quiz every 2 weeks, required reading, 2 exams, 6 discussion forums, and 2 assignments. You have to gradually use APA in the discussions, but he gives you information on how to use it.  He knows what he is talking about and wants you to understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Williams' class was organized and the 6 quizzes were easy. In the 6 discussion forums he expects you to gradually improve your writing to get higher scores, and I had to put effort into my posts. The online mid-term and final are open book. I thought this was a good course and taught me stuff I didn't know.
When I needed help with discussion forums, he gave me helpful feedback before I posted them, and lots of encouragement.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Williams had us do quizzes, one was dropped, along with several short assignments, group work in class, and a couple of short presentations. He expect students to show up and do the work. Most of my assignments got 'A's.

I actually took him for PSYC 3335 / personality and the workload was watching a video and reading half a chapter twice a week. There were also two presentations and a couple of open-book exams. Class was mostly activties with little lecture. Very do-able.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: You have to read every single chapter to be able to keep up with the tests/ quizzes. He also gives out pop quizzes and instead of using his hour of "mandatory" class to give an actual lecture, he gives you an hour-long video to watch on your own, and you "review" the chapter in class. If you want time for a job don't take him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This was a summer, 8-week course. Everything went smoothly, and he stayed in good communication with students and offfered helpful feedback on discussion posts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: So I have had Dr. Williams for three classes now. Careers in Psyc, cross cultural, and theories of personality. Each class had a different feel to it because they were either in-person, online, or hybrid. He covers the material in-depth, gives real life examples, and exams are open-book and multiple choice. Assignment instructions are detailed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Y'all rate this professor low, and yeah he had high standards, but he gave me feedback before submitting a major assignment, which upped my grade. I put in the effort, did the work, and have no complaints.

I learned about culture, and really enjoyed the course. AI is not allowed in his written assignments, which are a mixture of discussions, with the lowest score dropped, an interview where you have to find someone born outside the U.S., and a final presentation. Follow his assignment instructions to the letter and be prepared to do high-quality work

I felt prepared for the mid-term and final exams, which had study guides and practice questions. Quizzes are 12 minutes plus 1 minute grace, but that was usually enough time for the 10 multiple choice questions providing I read, watched the videos, and made notes. This professor sticks by his syllabuus policies, and grades strictly by the rubric.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Take his classes if you're willing to learn and put in effort. He has high standards and says it is because he wants us to do well in future classes and to set us up for success. Assignment instructions are detailed and clear. I learned to write assignments to match his rubrics and instructions. If you do this then you're good.

Do not take this professor. He takes points off for every little thing on an assignment and will not give clear instructions. The quizzes and exams are based the textbook but the textbook is very broad and covers a lot of material. The class itself is not hard at all but he makes it difficult to succeed.

This is perhaps one of the worst professors I've had at KSU. He is a ridiculously tough grader and unwilling to hear you out on anything. One tiny thing missing from an assignment? Well prepare to lose 10 points. He is impossible to work with on anything even though he says he'll hear his students out. Take anyone else.

Grading is ridiculously strict. Monotonous lectures. The quizzes are based on the textbook, but the textbook is so broad that it's impossible to be prepared for them. Throughout the semester, he asked for feedback but never implemented any change. Rubrics are a nightmare. Good luck passing even if you read the rubric 7 times.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: No amount of effort you put towards this class is enough. You are automatically setting yourself up for failure taking his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is very strict and wants you to really learn the information. I highly suggest you only take this guy if you want to learn. He's very tough, but its worth it if you want to learn and be in a class with a funny welsh man.

He's a very professor and people are saying don't take him, but I've taken him for 2 classes and learned a ton from it. He also likes to talk to the students and is overall a different kind of person and its nice to talk to and listen to him. definitely only take the class if you want to try and learn in it.

This is the only class I've ever failed, and it wasn't even difficult. I was struggling with mental and physical health all semester and all I got was faux sympathy. He wouldn't let me make up any missed assignments that were due to medical issues. He also didn't have clear instructions for assignments, and took points off for EVERYTHING.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Save yourself the trouble. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. If you struggle with tests do not take this class. If you think you deserve an A on an essay. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. He is the toughest grader I have ever had. You will spend at least 6-8 hours a week on this class and still barely pass or just straight up fail. Take another class if you can.

DO NOT take this professor for this class. He is so strict about his grading, and knocks points off for every little thing. I get As in all other classes, but NOT this one. His exams are 1 minute per question and the discussions are graded like a paper. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

please do not take this professor. I have never had a professor so EXTREMELY strict about what he wants and is extremely inconsistent with his grading. he is extremely rude to his students. you do get one drop for both discussions and quizzes but don't let that fool you. he grades extremely extremely hard. save your time and your money.
Does not make any exceptions. Time limits for quizzes and midterms are minimal. No other assignments to help balance out your grade.

He takes grading very seriously so definitely follow the rubric. He's very passionate about his class but if you are going to take his class you definitely need to put in the work. There were 2 big assignments (papers) that made up a big majority of your grade. The quizzes were a bit challenging.

He is a very entertaining professor and does seem passionate about teaching, but I would never take him again. He is the toughest grader I have ever had. For example, I usually get A's on every essay, but with this class, I cannot even pass one. You only get 1 minute per question for quizzes and offers no extra credit no matter how much you beg.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you struggle with tests do not take this course, all his test and quizzes are timed about 1 minute per question, you can't go forwards or backwards through the assessments and he doesn't let you review the assessment after you've finished. I was putting in 5-6 hours a week solely on this course, and I got a B. I would not take him again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He's a very nice person, but his grading instructions are not clear at all and the class is not well structured. You basically have to read the textbook and learn the material in your own time. The "practice questions" in the slides are way easier than the actual quiz questions. This class is the only B I have gotten. You have been warned.

I learned a lot more than I thought I  from showing up to class and doing the hybrid activities. This was one of my favorite classes this semester because I could relax and learn without having to take copious amounts of notes. Read before you come to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Just follow the instructions in the syllabus and assignments to the letter and you are golden. Try to reinvent the wheel, and miss out stuff from the rubric and you drop points.

Don't take this professor. He doesn't give clear grading instructions, he will go over the rubric, but no sample of assignment. He got more specific on one rubric after the class submitted the assignment.
